intro: Pilosocereus gaturianensis, commonly known as the Gaturian cactus, is a species of cactus native to Brazil. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil and minimal water. Pilosocereus gaturianensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
